TEXT: The applicant , PERSON , is a NORP national who was born in the L’viv region on DATE and currently resides in L’viv , GPE .

In DATE the applicant instituted proceedings in the local court of the GPE district of L’viv against the local accommodation office and the ORG local authority , seeking an order for repairs to be carried out to her apartment . She also sought compensation for moral damage , since her living conditions were unsatisfactory . On DATE the ORG of L’viv allowed her claims in part . On DATE the applicant ’s claims for compensation for moral damage were rejected by the Shevchenkivsky ORG of L’viv . On DATE the L’viv ORG upheld this decision .

On DATE the applicant lodged complaints with ORG in accordance with the procedure prescribed by the PERSON of DATE on the Introduction of Changes to the Code of Civil Procedure . On DATE a panel of CARDINAL judges of ORG of GPE refused to transfer the applicant ’s appeal for consideration on the merits to a chamber of ORG .
“ ORG is ORG of GPE . ”

“ Parties and other persons who participate in court proceedings , and the prosecutor and other persons who have not participated in the proceedings in which the court has decided on their rights and obligations , may lodge a cassation appeal against judgments and rulings adopted by the court of first instance , only in relation to a violation of the substantive or procedural law and rulings and judgments of an appeal court .
The basis for such an appeal is the incorrect application of the norms of substantive law or infringement of the norms of procedural law . ”

“ The deadline for lodging an application by the prosecutor is DATE from the date of delivery of the ruling or judgment of ORG , or DATE from the date of delivery of the ruling or judgment of the court of first instance , if these rulings or decisions have not been appealed against . ”

“ The issue of the transfer of the case for consideration by a judicial chamber is to be considered by a panel of CARDINAL judges , in camera , without the participation of the parties to the proceedings .
The case shall be transferred for a hearing by a judicial chamber if one of the judges of the court reaches that conclusion . ...
If the grounds for transfer of the case for consideration by the chamber are not satisfied , the court shall adopt a ruling refusing to allow the applicant ’s claims . ”
“ ORG has the power to :
CARDINAL ) adopt a ruling rejecting the application for annulment ;
CARDINAL ) adopt a ruling fully or partly annulling a judicial decision at issue and remitting the case for a re - hearing to the court of first instance or appellate court ;
CARDINAL ) adopt a ruling annulling the decision at issue and leaving in force a judgment that was quashed by an appeal court in error ;
CARDINAL ) adopt a ruling annulling a decisions at issue , terminating the proceedings in a civil case and refusing to allow an applicant ’s claims ;
CARDINAL ) change the decision on the merits of the case and not remit it for further consideration . ”
“ CARDINAL . This PERSON shall enter into force as from DATE .
CARDINAL . Laws and other normative acts adopted before this PERSON entered into force are effective in so far as their provisions do not conflict with LAW and this PERSON .
CARDINAL . Appeals in civil cases lodged before DATE shall be considered in accordance with the procedure adopted for the examination of appeals against local courts’ decisions .

CARDINAL . Protests against judicial decisions lodged before DATE shall be sent to ORG of GPE for consideration in accordance with the procedure for consideration of cassation appeals ( касаційних скарг ) .

CARDINAL . Decisions that have been adopted and have entered into force before DATE can be appealed against within DATE in accordance with the procedure for consideration of cassation appeals ( to ORG ) . ”
